articles.headline: Recalls Become a Hazard for Mayors
articles.snippet: Voters are mounting recall campaigns to oust mayors, sometimes for taking steps like raising taxes to keep their cities solvent.
articles.abstract: Voters are mounting recall campaigns to oust mayors, sometimes for taking steps like raising taxes to keep their cities solvent.
articles.lead_paragraph: The throw-the-rascals-out mood is so strong these days that some voters are not even waiting until Election Day  they are mounting recall campaigns to oust mayors in the middle of their terms, often as punishment for taking unpopular steps like raising taxes or laying off workers to keep their cities solvent.

articles.headline: Facebook Hopes Credits Make Dollars
articles.snippet: The currency, Credits, passed a milestone as the top developer of Facebook applications adopted it this month.
articles.abstract: The currency, Credits, passed a milestone as the top developer of Facebook applications adopted it this month.
articles.lead_paragraph: PALO ALTO, Calif.  For all its success, Google is often criticized for being a one-trick pony. After 12 years, the Internet search company is still struggling to find a significant new revenue source to supplement its lucrative text advertising business.

articles.headline: Vein Study Gets a Rare Challenge
articles.snippet: An editorial in The New England Journal of Medicine took the unusual step of criticizing a study on a blood-thinning drug published in the same edition.
articles.abstract: An editorial in The New England Journal of Medicine took the unusual step of criticizing a study on a blood-thinning drug published in the same edition.

articles.headline: Sony Raises Camera Feats to New Level
articles.snippet: Move over, S.L.R.’s, here comes the Alpha A55 camera, an I.L.C. (interchangeable-lens compact) from Sony.
articles.abstract: Move over, S.L.R.’s, here comes the Alpha A55 camera, an I.L.C. (interchangeable-lens compact) from Sony.
articles.lead_paragraph: When it made up the term “S.L.R.,” the technology terminology industry was not operating at its peak creative powers.

articles.headline: Insurers Scramble to Comply With New Rules
articles.snippet: Many companies are altering their business models to handle new health care regulations.
articles.abstract: Many companies are altering their business models to handle new health care regulations.
articles.lead_paragraph: The first big wave of new rules under the federal health care law goes into effect on Thursday, leaving many insurers scrambling to get ahead of the changes.

articles.headline: G.O.P. Cites Tax Cuts and Health Care as Main Focus
articles.snippet: House Republicans on Thursday are issuing a legislative blueprint called “A Pledge to America” that they hope will catapult them to a majority in the November elections.
articles.abstract: House Republicans on Thursday are issuing a legislative blueprint called “A Pledge to America” that they hope will catapult them to a majority in the November elections.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  House Republicans on Thursday will issue a legislative blueprint called “A Pledge to America” that they hope will catapult them to a majority in the November elections. Its goals include a permanent extension of all the Bush-era tax cuts, repeal of the newly enacted health care law, a cap on discretionary federal spending and an end to government control of the mortgage giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac.

articles.headline: China’s Disputes in Asia Buttress Influence of U.S.
articles.snippet: Washington is leaping into the middle of territorial and political disagreements between Beijing and its neighbors.
articles.abstract: Washington is leaping into the middle of territorial and political disagreements between Beijing and its neighbors.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING  For the last several years, one big theme has dominated talk of the future of Asia: As China rises, its neighbors are being inevitably drawn into its orbit, currying favor with the region’s new hegemonic power.

articles.headline: Buyers Send iPhones on a Long Relay to China
articles.snippet: Demand for Apple gadgets has created a system for buying iPhones in New York and reselling them in China.
articles.abstract: Demand for Apple gadgets has created a system for buying iPhones in New York and reselling them in China.
articles.lead_paragraph: They show up in the early-morning hours: Chinese men and women, waiting silently and somewhat nervously outside of Apple stores in New York. On some days the lines they form can be a block long.

articles.headline: Amid Tension, China Blocks Vital Exports to Japan
articles.snippet: Escalating a dispute over Japan’s detention of a Chinese fishing trawler captain, China halted exports to Japan of some crucial rare earth elements.
articles.abstract: Escalating a dispute over Japan’s detention of a Chinese fishing trawler captain, China halted exports to Japan of some crucial rare earth elements.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Sharply raising the stakes in a dispute over Japan’s detention of a Chinese fishing trawler captain, the Chinese government has blocked exports to Japan of a crucial category of minerals used in products like hybrid cars, wind turbines and guided missiles.

articles.headline: With Warning, Obama Presses China on Currency
articles.snippet: Putting the economy at the top of his agenda with China, President Obama pressed Prime Minister Wen Jiabao to immediately revalue the currency.
articles.abstract: Putting the economy at the top of his agenda with China, President Obama pressed Prime Minister Wen Jiabao to immediately revalue the currency.
articles.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS — President Obama increased pressure on China to immediately revalue its currency on Thursday, devoting most of a two-hour meeting with China’s prime minister to the issue and sending the message, according to one of his top aides, that if “the Chinese don’t take actions, we have other means of protecting U.S. interests.”
